CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1950, pg. 25 reads: "Round, Square Dancing Class - Round and square dancing classes are being held at the Kay Boys' Club every Tuesday evening. They are being taught by Irving Silverman, who has been teaching these types of dances for the past ten years.  Sessions are open to the public.  Mrs. Anne L. Penn is sponsor of the project.  Adults are taught from 9 to 11 P.M., and children's classes begin at 8:30 P.M.  Pictured are some of the students. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men and women standing in Kay Boys Club for dancing lessons, with man, possibly Irving Silverman, holding microphone near stage
